newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel Chemicals wins China potash order.
newsitem.headline: Israel Chemicals wins China potash order.

text.p: Visiting Chinese Vice-Premier Li Lanqing said China's Sinochem placed on Tuesday a $10 million order for 100,000 tonnes of potash from Israel Chemicals.
Li, heading a 30-member Chinese delegation, made the announcement during a meeting with Shoul Eisenberg, chairman of Israel Corporation ILCL.TA, parent company of Israel Chemicals, officials said.

Israel Chemical officials described the deal as very important to the company because Sinochem had in the past 18 months reduced signficantly its potash purchases from Israel, buying instead from a Canadian supplier.

In reply to reporters' questions, Eisenberg confirmed news reports he was involved in establishing a diamond exchange in Shanghai. He and Li planned to visit the Israeli Diamond Exchange near Tel Aviv on Wednesday.
Eisenberg has maintained close business links with Asia for decades.
